_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

For further information contact Michael Peterson,  Safety & Regulations manager

I. The facility policy
   A. The owners, managers, and employees of Sweetland Ag Tech LLC., Muscatine, Ia are commited to the prevention of any accidntal release of Anhydrous Ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, LEPC, or other authorities, to migrate any release and to minimize the impact of the release on people and the environment.  Our company policy would be to shutoff any emergency valves that is possible for us to get to.  Evacute any persons in the immediate way of harm.

II.  Facility Information
    A.  The primary activity at the facility is the storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia for sale to farmers.

    B.  Anhydrous Ammonia si received, and distributed for application on crops as fertilizer nutrients.

    C.  The maximum quanity stored would be 79,000 pounds in a 18,000 gallon storage tank *Note maximum quanity allowed to be stored is 85% of storage tank size.

III.  The worst case release scenario and the alternativerelease scenario.
     A.  The worst case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of the sorage tank over a ten minute time span.  The maximum quanity release would be 79,000 pounds, which represents the volume of the tank at 85% capacity as limited by design standards.  The distance to the toxic endpoints is 1.06 miles.

     B.  The alternitive release scenario is based on release from a break in a transfer hose.  The distance to the toxic endpoint is 0.59 miles.  To keep mitigation to a minimum we would shut off all emergency valves possible, call fire department, and keep area evacuated.

IV.  The accidental release, prevention program.
      A.  The facility has implanted the provisions of the safety requirements for the storage and handling of anydrous ammonia, K-61, published by the American Standards Institute Inc.

      B.  The f

acility has implemented the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29CFR 1910.111, storage and handling of Anydrous Ammonia.  Due to the fact that we are inspected annually by IDALS, we do manual and visual inspections periodically to maintain an accident free facility.

V.  The five year accident history.
     A.  There has been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia that has caused any death, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor have resulted in any off site deaths, injury, evacuations, sheltering, property damage, or environmental damage.

VI.  The emergency response program.
      A.  The facility has a written emeregency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.

      B.  The facility has provided to the state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA title III (EPCRA).

     C.  The facilty has a written emergency response program, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.120 including pre emergency planning and employee training.  We at Sweetland Ag Tech take pride in personal and plant safety by conducting periodic plant inspections, annual classroom and hands on training.  Also annual inspection by IDALS.

VII.  Planned changes to improve safety.
      A.  Safety improvements is an ongoing process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are preformed to access the maintenance of safe conditions and evaluate employee training.  There are no specific anhydrous ammonia saftey recommendations at this point in time.
